intro: Astronia ponapensis, commonly known as the Ponapé astronia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Pohnpei in the Micronesia region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It grows in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
